Teaching

Courses

For more teaching information, see my vita.

  • Guest lecture, "Mass Media and the American Indian Movement," COMM189H: Communications and Social Movements, (Prof. Carly Woods), Fall 2011)
  • Guest lecture, "Show Indians and Buffalo Bill's Wild West," HIST359: Mythic West (Prof. Douglas Seefeldt), Spring 2010
  • Teaching Assistant, U.S. before 1877 (Prof. Brenden Rensink), Fall 2010
    • Guest lecture: "Thomas Jefferson and the American West"
    • Guest lecture: "Empire of Liberty: Culture, Society, and Politics in the Early Republic"
  • Teaching Assistant, U.S. since 1877 (Prof. William Thomas), Spring 2009
    • Guest lecture: "The Origins of Red Power and the American Indian Movement"
  • Teaching Assistant, African Culture and Civilization, (Prof. Dawne Curry), Fall 2008

Projects

  • POND: Participating Online In-Depth: Depreciated project. Built under the direction of William G. Thomas that served as a research portal for undergraduate students using digital archives for primary source research.
